Key Arguments: The bill will erode freedom of speech.
Differing expert opinions are natural and should be allowed.
Historical context shows that what is considered true can change over time.
Citizens should have the right to form their own conclusions and express differing opinions.
The bill could lead to a future where freedom of speech is suppressed, similar to authoritarian regimes.
Notable Quotes: Healthy, respectful, and open discussions about any issue MUST be allowed, and we as citizens of a democratic country, have the right to form our own conclusions about the issues.
I demand that the government NOT proceed down this undemocratic and totalitarian path.
